situation: M was startled by the sound of thunder during an art class and started to scream, disrupting the class and appearing visibly upset.
action: The teacher aide, understanding his sensitivity to sound, quickly guided M to the sensory room where he could calm down with dim lighting and calming sensory materials.
effect: After spending some time in the sensory room, M managed to regain his composure and returned to the classroom in a much calmer state, ready to participate in the remainder of the class. The quick intervention prevented further escalation.
